This is probably one of the best First Person Shooters ever made, provided you ignore the tedious unskippable intro* and the crappy lighting**. Other than that however it's an excellent game (unlike the sequel, which was terrible)

*I recommend just leaving the computer entirely and doing something else during the tram sequence. It doesn't even have any exposition so it can (and should) be safely ignored.

**use "r_fullbright 1" in the console to eliminate excessive shadows

Holeh BALLS! This game is amazing! I'm playing on the hardest difficulty and it really adds a nice challenge. The games lack of clear direction actually adds to the game instead of taking away from it, it makes you feel like you are actually there. This is an amazing feature that isn't as common today with games that give you instruction for everything. The gunplay also feels suprisingly smooth. This game also has a pretty decent horror element too, its managed to make me jump frequently. For a game thats 16 years old, it looks amazing, I almost forgot that I was playing a game that came out in 1998. For a game as old as me, 1 billion/10. Worth every penny.

Es el comienso del black mesa que gordon freeman era nuevo sientifico de black mesa. ese son recuerdo del pasado que administrador con el Dr Gualas breins. pero eran mejores amgios con gordon que esta con Eli vance y el Isaac Clainer.

É um ótimo FPS com uma ambientação e uma história bem interessantes. Você está no controle de Gordon Freeman, um físico que trabalha na Black Mesa Research Facility, onde são feitos diversos tipos de pesquisas. Freeman participa de um experimento que dá errado, criando um efeito cascata que ocasiona a invasão de aliens no local. Assim, ele precisa entender como reverter o incidente. O jogo tem diversos tipos de armas e de inimigos que, sem querer dar muito spoiler, não se limitam a extra-terrestres. A ação é o foco, mas não quer dizer que você não terá que parar e pensar um pouco em alguns momentos para resolver situações pontuais a fim de poder progredir. Uma facilidade que o jogo tem é poder salvá-lo a qualquer momento. Hoje em dia os gráficos não são tão atrativos, mas para a época de lançamento com certeza surpreenderam. A trilha sonora é quase inexistente, servindo para marcar apenas alguns momentos. Há mais de um final possível e um deles vai desenvolver os eventos em Half-Life 2. Então, se você tem interesse em shooters clássicos, não deixe de conferir Half-Life e de entender os detalhes de sua trama. E lembrando que existem mais duas histórias que se passam nas mesmas ocasiões, com personagens diferentes, em Half-Life Opposing Force e Half-Life Blue Shift.

Half-Life I was a game I'd heard a lot about, but I had neer played anything like it (the closest was probably 007: Goldeneye, so I wasn't quite certain of what I was getting into at first, but the Half-Life collection was on sale for only some $15, so I figured I'd take a risk.
And I'm so glad I did.  I decided, on a whim, to play it on its hardest difficulty, and I recommend you do the same, because it's just hard enough to make you be really careful, but not so hard to bring you to throw your controller across the room.
I'll address my thoughts on Half-Life I in the tradition of YouTube reviewer The Completionist:

Story 9/10
A la Zelda I, story takes a backseat in Half Life I, and I personally really like that.  There IS a story, but unlike in so many triple-A titles, it doesn't demand so much attention that the rest is neglected.  The story that exists can basically be summed up like this: 
You are Gordon Freeman, a scientist with special training in the use of a power-augmenting suit, working in a top-secret facility known as Black Mesa.  After an experiment goes horribly wrong, alien creatures with no greater purpose than to kill and infect humans begin appearing around the facility, and you, as one of the only able-bodied people alive, must fight your way out of the death trap that Black Mesa has become.  But along the way, you notice a mysterious man watching your every move...
And that's it.  Most of the developments throughout the game are finding out one teensy little detail about Black Mesa's past through a stray word in normal dialogue or through coming across the aforementioned mysterious figure who watches you throughout the game.
I love it.  Having the story be so simple lets the gameplay and puzzles take a much larger role in my mind.  Instead of thinking to myself, "I have to get past this puzzle so that I can know what happened to Jim," I'm thinking "hmm...if I only have 27 health and I need to get past the lightning-throwing alien with only two bullets in my revolver, how quick will I need to fire?  And how close should I get?  Are there more enemies around him?  Maybe I could sneak past him and find a stock of ammo..." and so on.  The game prompts the player to think so much, in part because you're playing it not for the story but for the puzzles.
That is, in my opinion, one of Half-Life I's strongest points.  However, I don't give it a 10/10 for story because I feel like it could be just a little bit more engaging.  If it were as engaging as Portal I in story, it would be absolutely perfect.

Gameplay 9.8/10
This game is so damn fun to play.  The controls, at least for PC, are fantastic, because you can make them be whatever the crap you want.  Because it's an FPS, you NEED to have a mouse, but what self-respecting gamer doesn't?  (Unless you like to make games harder by playing them without a mouse on purpose, in which case, props to you.)  Like I said in the "Story" section, gameplay takes an incredibly important role in this game, and was absolutely perfected.
One of the reasons for this is that the gameplay is so simple.  You can jump, you can shoot/use various weapons, you can crouch, and you can use a flashlight.  That's it.  No silly quick-time events, no complicated set of moves, no vast arrays of powers, just jumping, weapons, crouching, and flashlight.
What gives the game depth from here is the plethora of different weapons you can get.  No weapon is similar in more than one way, and every one has different strengths and weaknesses.  Basically, no one weapon is "the best"; even the strongest weapon in the game, the lazer gun, is balanced out because you can have an absolute maximum of 60 shots, and because it fires so rapidly, it's easy to use more ammo than you needed to.  My favorite weapon by far is the revolver, because it has a nice sound, it reloads fast, and it does great damage.  It's big drawbacks, however, are that ammo for it is very scarce, and so must be well-conserved, and it has pretty slow firing time.  And all weapons are like that: the crowbar is the weakest weapon, and must be used up close, but it uses no ammo and so has no reload time; the machine gun has the fastest firing and reload times, and can double as a grenade launcher if you have ammo for it, but really low damage and is hard to aim; the rocket launcher deals enormous damage, but can easily kill you, has terrible reload and firing time, ammo is scarce, and the shots automatically will fly around and hit nothing if you don't get reasonably close to your enemy; and the list goes on and on.
Somehow, Half Life I gives you a wide array of interesting and equally useful weapons to use in the different situations it puts you in.  Every weapon has strengths and weaknesses, every one is useful in different situations, and any could end up your favorite without that impacting your enjoyment of the game.
The only reason I don't give gameplay a 10/10 is because the rocket launcher's rockets are the biggest pain in the butt to hit anything with.

Presentation 10/10
This game was revolutionary for its time, and still looks great.  It's not COD: AW, but I like that it doesn't need to use the crutch of HD graphics like some games.  The music is fantastic, and used sparingly, which helps a ton with the mood, because you'll know when something important is happening just because of music playing.  There isn't much to say here, because it's not something you really notice, but overall, the presentation is perfect.

True Completionist fans are expecting me to move on to the final component of his reviewing style, the final level, but the problem is, I haven't gotten there yet.  I just wanted to post this review now, and I might come back and edit it later to add the "Final Level" portion if I feel like it.  (But no promises; I probably won't.)

Overall: 9.6/10
Verdict: What the hell are you waiting for?  BUY IT!!!

Stunningly cool. A blast from beginning to end. No filler in this one and it's a crazy long game. This is the FPS that every thing else is based on. Before Half Life we just had run and gun shooters like Quake. Then Valve happened and we got a cinematic masterpiece. No one had made an FPS like this before. There would be no Call of Duty or any other modern shooter without this one setting the standard. 

The graphics look awfully dated by today's standards but the game is so damn good it's totally worth playing anyway. If you really can't get past the Quake 2 style graphics then I highly HIGHLY recommend downloading a remake of this game. It's called Black Mesa and it's Half Life 1 redone with the SOurce engine and hi-res graphics. It is incredible and shows that this game is still a blast to play to this day. The story is very cool and the game is loaded with tons of moments you will always remember. This series is regarded as the pinnacle for a reason. If you've seriously never played this then get it. It's worth it. Or better yet, download Black Mesa.

By the way, back in the day, there was nothing cooler than Half Life 1 deathmatch. To this day I say it was the most fun I've ever had in multiplayer insanity, period. The mod scene was enormous and I can't even begin to think of how many hours I blew away in deathmatch. I probably have more memories of HL deathmatch than any other video game. My online nemesis was Loach. I remember you, sir. Every time you joined it was a frantic battle through hell to remain at the top of the scoreboard and every map, 1st and 2nd place went to us. If Black Mesa ever gets deathmatch going  and I should run into you again, it's on! And bring your Grinch model.

Sin duda, este ha sido mi juego favorito de toda la vida, todavia recuerdo mi primer encuentro con este juego, la primera fraccion de segundo que quedo grabada en mi retina, mi hermano con su amigo jugando en la sala de entrenamiento entrando por un conducto metalico oxidado con una flecha vertical con una luz roja al fondo, en un dia nublado al mediodia, sin duda, Half-Life, uno de los mejores juegos que se ha creado, a pesar de su simpleza grafica, el contexto del juego, la historia, el ambiente, las armas, los enemigos... tambien considerar la gigantesca cantidad de MOD's que se han creado a base de este juego, que porcierto yo jugue muchos de ellos y me dieron muchisima entretencion.

Llevo muchos años Half-Life conmigo, me dio bastantes cosas que no podria decirlas todas.

Half-Life combines great storytelling with intense action and advanced technology to create a frighteningly realistic world where players need to think smart to survive. Half-Life has won more than 50 Game of the Year awards from publications around the world. I have fully enjoyed this game and I would seriously recommend this game to any player. As half-life is an older game [1999] it will run on any computer built today, the game runs smoothly on my old laptop.

Rather than give a full review of this I will list the goods and bads:

Good:

+ Great Stephen Kingesque storyline 
+ There are always new enemies to make the game not so stale
+ Well dated
+ Gold Source engine is great
+ The soundtrack is memorable
+ Has numerous puzzles that makes you think

Bad:

- Resources sometimes runs out and when you are under a sniper, you don't have anything to fight off so, you have to use cheats

I give this game a 9/10. Even if the game runs out of ammo, it still makes up for it in a big way.

Half-Life has 8 letters. (Not counting the -) You write 8 like eight. Eight has 5 letters. 8-5 is 3. OMG Half-Life 3 confirmed!

Half-Life hat das Shooter-Genre massgeblich geprägt und gehört definitiv zu den Klassikern die man gespielt haben sollte. Wenn man von der stark gealterten Grafik absieht, vermag es auch heute noch, den Spieler bis zu zwölf Stunden bei der Stange zu halten (wenn man besonders gründlich spielt). 

Sehr positiv ist zudem, dass das Shooter-Gameplay durch Jump 'n Run-Passagen und kleine Rätsel ergänzt wird, was das Ganze deutlich auflockert. In der Hinsicht ist ganz interessant, dass dem Spieler zu keinem Zeitpunkt gesagt wird, wie er vorgehen soll, was in Zeiten von Questmarkern nicht mehr selbstverständlich ist. Viel mehr ist es so, dass das Spiel, wenn überhaupt, kleine Andeutungen macht und es dem Spieler überlässt, sich den Rest zusammenzureimen. 

Zur Handlung muss nicht mehr viel geschrieben werden, das Ende ist jedoch auf jeden Fall unerwartet und lässt einige Fragen offen, was wirklich nett ist.

Half-Life ist ein toller, klassischer Shooter, der auch heute noch Spass macht.

Edit: Die deutsche Fassung ist leider stark geschnitten.

Half-Life still holds up after all these years. It still has great gameplay, great level design and an eerie and claustrophobic feel, which I think no other game has been able to capture, not even the sequels or Black Mesa, and I think its old geometry and limited interactivity improve that feeling.

Half-Life is a classic for good reason. At the time it came out, there were very few story-driven FPS games, and it set a pretty high bar. I feel like its storytelling stands the test of time and it holds a big enough place in FPS history that fans of the genre who are interested in exploring the past should definitely try it.

People who prefer to play their FPS games with a controller should be aware that it was made at a time when no one hooked controllers up to PCs to play FPS games, and it still doesn't have controller support.

Half-Life is a sci-fi, action game. I'll review the game in some paragraphs and give it a rato 1-10.

[Gameplay]
There's nothing I can say about that. Everyone have played that. It's a very good game, really interesting and it's bloody.
There are much weapons to have fun in this game. You can shoot soldiers, scientists, friends, aliens, zombies, crabs, more aliens, etc... You're name in the game is Gordon Freeman, and you're task is to test a new project. But everything goes bum-bum, and there you go... Aliens...Aliens Everywhere. 11/10 - Best gameplay ever.

[Quests & Chapters]
There are many missions in the game. The chapter I've ever hated is "Lambda Core". I don't know, I don't like the atmosphere, which makes me wanna' play this mission again, and again, and again. My favourite is "Xen" 10/10 - Can be better, but for late 90's game that's perfect.

[Monsters]
There are very much creatures in this game. From Headcrab to Zombies and Alien Sharks, which get you with one hit.
10/10 - Wooaahh.

[Final Review]
In the game you're followed by G-Man. A mystic man with suitcase. The game is very good as I said. There are very much things to do in it. BUT... Steam version is fucked up. There are very much bugs and yeah. I'm sorry for that... I bought it becouse of nostalgia. The goodest thing is that, the old models are converted to the newest. 9This models was in HL:OP) 10.5/10 - HIGHLY recommend this game!
Half-Life is a game that still holds up even to this day. Its got fun gunplay, enemy variety, level design, replayability, and last but not least the ability to bunny hop if you well wish!!
Very great game! It is great to play an old classic for the first time.

Very interesting game. If you bought the Valve Complete Pack (which mean you have all the series of Half-Life), then I totally suggest playing it in order, like so: 

Half-Life: Blue Shift
Half-Life
Half-Life: Opposing Force
Portal
Half-Life 2
Half-Life 2: Lost Coast
Half-Life 2: Episode One
Half-Life 2: Episode Two
Portal 2

So here's my opinion to the glorified game called Half-Life.
When i first saw this gamein the store i thought to my self:"Men this is described to be an all-time classic.This game must be good!"
But then sadly after I reached the second half of this game i realized that it was total bullshit.
Don't get me wrong,the game design is one of the best I have ever seen but men...the enemies.
I really like playing games like serious sam on serious mode or Super Meat Boy but...I never saw enemies like this before in any videogame.It was just unfair.Maybe it was just the fact that there were no hit indicators because the censored german version doesn't include blood because our goverment thinks shooting soldiers and aliens is alright but showing blood in a videogame?That simply goes to far!Especially those little red Pixels!How disgusting would that be?
But back to the topic....The enemies sometimes are just standing there psoing like they would be in a photoshooting and  when you think they aren't a big threat to you they immediatly turn around and sometimes even 1-shot kill you with 80%hp (not joking here).But worst about this is that there are moments were you hide in a little room surrounded by like 500 enemies hoping they just vanish.What makes this really bad is enemies who have no chance to miss you(those vortigaunts can **** themselves....) and enemies who have got homing projectiles.Maybe its just because I played it on hard mode but....I really don't think that a "hard mode" should look like that.And when you finally killed of the enemies after killing 1 by 1 for 3 hours with quicksave and quickload and you still life with like 5% hp then there is a point in the game where you have to lose HP to get somewhere.I'm not lieing here there are little invincible fishs from which you believe are just there to look good who will bite you and kill you immediatly on low life.
Another problem is that there are nearly no ammo and medikits which means that you have to save the game every 3 seconds and sometimes fights against soldiers and tanks with just your crowbar.In my opinion the only thing which is good about this game is the design.So don't waste your money and buy another game(if it's on sale (1-3$)I would recommend this game tho)

tl;dr If you are german or just don't like getting 1-shotted by the AI just buy another game and save your money.
Despite the fact that this game is very old I love it!

Buy it or steam will kill you... really... 

20/10
